[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/pipeline/lint_processor.rs] [AuthZ: Module attributes] [Privilege inheritance] Module-level skip attributes apply to all functions (lines 82-86) - can attackers use module-level skips to mass-disable security checks across entire modules? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/pipeline/lint_processor.rs] [InfoLeak: Error messages] [Sensitive data exposure] When checkers report issues via check(), are error messages sanitized, or can they leak sensitive compiler internals or private function implementations? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/pipeline/lint_processor.rs] [InfoLeak: FunctionTarget access] [Metadata exposure] Checkers receive full FunctionTarget with all metadata - can malicious checkers extract and exfiltrate sensitive information about other modules or system internals? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/pipeline/lint_processor.rs] [InfoLeak: known_checker_names] [Enumeration attack] The known_checker_names set reveals all available checkers - can attackers use this information to systematically identify and skip all security-critical checks? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/pipeline/lint_processor.rs] [InfoLeak: Pipeline composition] [Attack surface disclosure] The get_applicable_linter_pipeline() returns the full list of active checkers - does this reveal which security checks are enabled, helping attackers craft exploits? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/pipeline/lint_processor.rs] [Security: Determinism] [Non-deterministic execution] If checker execution order is non-deterministic (lines 39-41), can this cause inconsistent validation results across different compilation runs or validator nodes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/pipeline/lint_processor.rs] [Security: Completeness] [Coverage gap] Only stackless bytecode checkers are executed (line 70) - are there security issues detectable only in other representations that are missed by this processor? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/pipeline/lint_processor.rs] [Security: Defense in depth] [Single point of failure] If LintProcessor is the only security validation stage, does bypassing it (e.g., via skip attributes) completely disable security checks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/pipeline/lint_processor.rs] [Security: Audit trail] [Missing logging] There's no apparent logging of which checks were skipped or executed - can attackers bypass checks without detection or audit trail? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/pipeline/lint_processor.rs] [Security: Fail-secure] [Default-permit] When external_checks is empty (line 60-62), no validation occurs - is this a secure default, or should compilation fail when security checks are unavailable? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/pipeline/lint_processor.rs] [Pipeline: Processor ordering] [Dependency violation] LintProcessor assumes liveness analysis is complete (per comments line 5-6) - if executed out of order, can this cause incorrect lint results or crashes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/pipeline/lint_processor.rs] [Pipeline: Data consistency] [State corruption] FunctionData passes through unchanged (line 42) - if previous processors left data in inconsistent state, does this propagate errors to subsequent stages? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/pipeline/lint_processor.rs] [Pipeline: Annotation dependencies] [Missing prerequisites] Comments mention liveness analysis prerequisite - if required annotations are missing, do checkers fail gracefully or crash? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/pipeline/lint_processor.rs] [Pipeline: Idempotence] [Repeated execution] If process() is called multiple times on the same function, are checkers idempotent, or can repeated execution cause state corruption or incorrect results? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/pipeline/lint_processor.rs] [Pipeline: Global state] [Cross-contamination] Multiple functions are processed sequentially - can global state mutations in one checker affect validation results for subsequent functions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/pipeline/lint_processor.rs] [Compiler: AST manipulation] [Metadata corruption] If attributes are manipulated during compilation, can attackers inject skip directives at runtime to bypass checks that were present at parse time? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/pipeline/lint_processor.rs] [Compiler: Version compatibility] [Checker incompatibility] If external_checks are compiled with different compiler versions, can ABI incompatibilities cause crashes or incorrect behavior? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/pipeline/lint_processor.rs] [Compiler: Name mangling] [Symbol collision] If function or module names are mangled differently, can this cause get_name() comparisons to fail incorrectly, bypassing skip directives? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/pipeline/lint_processor.rs] [Compiler: Optimization] [Dead code elimination] If compiler optimizations remove functions before linting, can security issues in dead code remain undetected despite being potentially exploitable? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/pipeline/lint_processor.rs] [Compiler: Macro expansion] [Pre-processor attack] If Move supports macros, can macro-expanded code bypass lint checks that only examine post-expansion code? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/pipeline/lint_processor.rs] [Move: Resource safety] [Type confusion] If checkers don't validate Move resource types correctly, can attackers craft bytecode that violates resource safety guarantees? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/pipeline/lint_processor.rs] [Move: Capability bypass] [Access control] If lint checks validate capability patterns, can skip attributes be used to bypass capability checks and enable unauthorized operations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/pipeline/lint_processor.rs] [Move: Module publishing] [Deployment validation] For modules intended for on-chain deployment, does lint validation failure prevent deployment, or can attackers deploy modules that failed linting? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/pipeline/lint_processor.rs] [Move: Generic instantiation] [Type substitution] If linting happens before generic instantiation, can attackers craft generic functions that pass linting but become unsafe when instantiated? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/pipeline/lint_processor.rs] [Move: Inline expansion] [Visibility bypass] If inline functions are expanded after linting, can private functions become inlined into public contexts bypassing visibility checks? (Medium)
